revised_title: Body Size and Extinction Threat in Birds
tldr: The authors compared the body sizes of globally endangered and common bird species and found that threatened species are, on average, larger-bodied than non-threatened species. This difference is not due to size differences between island endemic species and species with continental distributions. The study suggests that large-bodied birds may be more at risk of extinction than small-bodied species.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Conservation
